subject: Education
title: Picture Superiority: Why Images Outlast Words
description: A micro-lesson that makes Picture Superiority: Why Images Outlast Words usable.

hook.text: Show people 2,500 images for ten seconds each and they'll recognize 90% of them days later.

buildup.text: The picture superiority effect shows that images are remembered far better than words alone.

discovery.text: Images are automatically encoded both visually and verbally, creating dual memory traces.

twist.text: A word like 'dog' is stored once. A picture of a dog is stored as both image and label.

climax.text: Textbooks with relevant diagrams increase test scores by up to 89% over text-only formats.

punchline.text: A picture is worth a thousand memories.

quiz.question: Why are pictures remembered better than words?
options: Images are encoded both visually and verbally, creating dual memory traces
The brain has unlimited storage for images but limited storage for words
Pictures activate emotions while words cannot
